summary: The Security Council, recalling its previous resolutions on the Central African Republic, adopted Resolution 2181 (2014) at its 7280th meeting on 21 October 2014. The Council determined that the situation in the Central African Republic continues to threaten international peace and security. Acting under Chapter VII of the UN Charter, it decided to extend the authorization of the European Union operation, as contained in paragraph 4 of resolution 2134 (2014), until 15 March 2015. The Council also decided to remain seized of the matter.
